item.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard Developers Discuss Bringing the Blood Mage Back
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Blood Mage won't be in Dragon Age: The Veilguard at launch, but BioWare may bring it back later.
  • Future Blood Mages could come as a separate class with better dialogue reactivity.

Dragon Age: The Veilguard will not be featuring the Blood Mage at launch, but BioWare hasn't closed the door completely on the notorious specialization coming back in the future. Whereas it could be argued that the Inquisitor could have been a Blood Mage in secret, the narrative in Dragon Age: The Veilguard is fundamentally incompatible with Blood Magic as a concept. Given Rook's unique connection to the Fade after the events of the Prologue, any use of Blood Magic likely ends in demonic possession.

That being said, many fans miss the Blood Mage as a specialization, especially given its popularity in the first two Dragon Age titles. However, there has always been an undercurrent of ludonarrative dissonance between how the world of Thedas treated a Dragon Age protagonist for dabbling in Blood Magic, versus how it treated other practitioners of the art. Despite Kirkwall being a hotbed of Blood Magic, Hawke was not only allowed to be a Blood Mage, but could even potentially side with the Templars during their purge in Act 3.

In a recent showcase of The Veilguard 's classes and specializations, Arekkz Gaming revealed that BioWare was not only interested in bringing back the Blood Mage, but also in finally doing it right. Not having proper reactivity in dialogue and story seemingly bothered the developers, and as such, any future version of the Blood Mage would likely be done as a separate class. Considering that players can refund their entire skill tree in Dragon Age: The Veilguard , this decision is logical from a gameplay standpoint as well.

Any Blood Mages in Future Dragon Age Content May Come As a Separate Class

Since Dragon Age: The Veilguard has no confirmed DLCs or expansion packs, it's more likely that BioWare will only do Blood Magic in a future sequel. What separates Blood Mages from other classes in Dragon Age , is that they tend to have a more dubious morality due to the nature of their practice. Not only are its users more susceptible to demonic possession, but its power is used for corrupting purposes such as mind control and demon summoning. As a fantasy archetype, Blood Mages are closer to Warlocks than Wizards, which may justify BioWare's desire to split the specialization off into its own class.

Having better reactivity in dialogue would go a long way towards legitimizing Blood Magic in a Dragon Age game, as that was often one of its main critiques, both for the Hero of Ferelden, and the Champion of Kirkwall. It should be noted that while Origins allowed players to make evil decisions, Dragon Age: Inquisition was far more restrained in this regard. Though it remains to be seen what narrative freedom will be afforded to Rook in The Veilguard , the return of Blood Magic should only be entertained if Dragon Age players can lean towards the path of villainy once again.

item.title: Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster: All Trophies/Achievements Guide
item.description:
There are multiple game modes for players to complete in Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster, with all of them revolving around Frank surviving in a zombie-infested mall. Along with the multiple game modes to complete, there are also multiple endings to get through the base 72-hour mode and Overtime.

For players looking to get more out of the game, there is also a list of achievements that can be completed with most of them being done while normally playing the game. This article will reveal all the hidden trophies, meaning there may be some spoilers below.

******* This Article Contains Spoilers For Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster ******

How To Get Every Trophy/Achievement In Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster

Trophy Name

How To Get It

Goodbye, Willamette!

  • Complete all other achievements on this list.

Welcome To Hell

  • Arrive at the mall during the intro of the game.

Zombie Hunter

  • Kill 1,000 zombies.

Zombie Killer

  • Kill 10,000 Zombies.

Zombie Annihilator

  • Kill 53,594 zombies, easily done by driving around in the maintenance tunnels or naturally while trying to fill out the rest of this list.

Self Defense

  • Find and kill one psychopath.

Punisher

  • Find 10 Psychopaths by listening for scoops from Otis and kill them all.

No, Thank You

  • Kill 100 cultists.
  • Cultists will begin spawning randomly throughout the mall in 72-hour and the infinity game modes after the cutscene of them arriving plays.

Legendary Soldier

  • Defeat 10 special forces that will begin to spawn during Overtime mode.

Hella Copter

  • A helicopter will appear periodically during Overtime mode and can be shot down using guns.

Tour Guide

  • Escort 8 survivors at once.
  • Listen for scoops for any survivors and save them all without returning to the security room.

The Grateful Eight

  • Escort 8 female survivors at once.
  • Listen for scoops focused on female survivors and save them all without returning to the security room.

Full Set

  • Meet every character in the Notebook, it doesn't matter if they live or die. This includes survivors, main story characters, and Psychos .

Humanist

  • Save 10 survivors and get a good ending where they are evacuated from the mall.

Saint

  • Save 50 survivors and get a good ending where they are evacuated from the mall.

Photojournalist

  • Take a photo, which is done during the intro to the game.

The Artiste

  • Get a photo score of 10,000 PP. Use novelty masks and lots of zombies to boost the score, along with a few survivors preferably in action shots.

Group Photo

  • Take a photo of 50 zombies, easily done in most sections of the maintenance tunnels.

Portraiture

  • Take a photo of 10 different survivors.

Census Taker

  • Take a photo of 30 different survivors.

Psycho Photo

  • Take pictures of four Psychos during a fight with them, and listen to Otis' calls for scoops to track down Psychos.

PP Photo

  • Find and photograph 10 PP stickers.

PP Collector

  • There are 100 PP sticks found throughout the mall that appear as small stickers on any surface, so you'll need to search low and high for each one and take a picture of it.

Sharp Dresser

  • Change into 5 costumes.
  • Enter five random clothing stores and there will usually be a costume to try on for this achievement.

Clothes Horse

  • Change into all costumes in the mall.
  • The costume menu in the security room will tell you where to get each costume in the mall. There are 46 in total.

Juice Freak

  • Mix all 7 juices by combining food items into blenders in restaurants.

Item Smasher

  • Break 30 items.
  • Simply using melee weapons until they break will complete this trophy.

Bullet Point

  • Fire 300 bullets.
  • Clear the gun store and keep grabbing handguns or wait until Overtime and use machine guns dropped from Special Forces.

Trainsmissionary

  • Answer 30 calls from Otis, which will happen naturally during the 72-hour mode, just be sure to answer everyone.

Road Rage

  • Defeat 500 zombies with a vehicle.
  • Find the car in the parking lot of Leisure Park and drive over the zombies throughout the park.

Freefall

  • Drop from at least 16 feet.
  • Jump down off the second floor of the mall and down to the first.

Marathon Runner

  • Run 26.2 miles, which is usually done while trying to finish all other achievements.

Strike!

  • Hit five zombies with one bowling ball.
  • Bowling balls are found in most sports stores, you'll just need to find a group of them lined up which is easily done in the maintenance tunnels.

Costume Party

  • Place novelty masks on 10 zombies.
  • These novelty masks are found in most toy stores and are needed to complete Photo Challenge.

Raining Zombies

  • Knock 10 zombies aside with a parasol.
  • Parasols are large umbrellas that Frank can charge with, knocking aside any zombies he runs through.

Rampage

  • Defeat 100 enemies with Rocket Launchers.
  • These are found during Overtime Mode often dropped by Special Forces; killing zombies is the easiest method.

Karate Champ

  • Defeat 30 Special Forces soldiers barehanded.
  • Special Forces soldiers spawn during Overtime ; and will require a lot of patience and healing items to take out with just your fists. They do spawn randomly throughout the mall and will keep respawning throughout the mode.

Zombie Road

  • Find a large crowd of zombies and use the Zombie Walk ability to walk across as many in the group as possible.

Carjacker

  • Kill all the convicts that spawn in Leisure Park on the first night and take their vehicle.

Stunt Rider

  • Jump a car or motorcycle at least 33 feet.
  • Leisure Park has some hills that can be hit right on a motorcycle or wait until after case 4-1 for one to spawn in the mall where better ramps can be found.

Nice Shot!

  • Hit a golf ball at least 100 meters.
  • Find a golf club in a sporting store then take it to Leisure Park in the center of the mall; hitting a ball across the park is easily 100 meters.

Never Give Up

  • Start a new game using an existing save file.

Mall Worker

  • Find the secret passageway.
  • Complete the Out Of Control scoop on Day 1 and follow Greg after saving him.

Snuff Shot B

  • Find zombie Brad.
  • After defusing the bombs in the maintenance tunnels, go back to find a zombified Brad.

Snuff Shot J

  • Find zombie Jessie
  • Wait for Jessie to die during the events of the main story and return to the Security Room to find her as a zombie.

Level Max

  • Reach level 50.

Overtime Mode

  • Complete all the main story cases during the 72-hour mode and be at the helipad on time to leave to get the best ending.

∞ Mode

  • Get the best ending in the 72-hour mode to unlock Overtime mode, then get the good ending during Overtime .

3 Day Survivor

  • Survive 3 days and is achievable by completing the base 72-hour game mode.

5 Day Survivor

  • Survive 5 days during infinity mode.

7 Day Survivor

  • Survive 7 days during infinity mode.

item.title: Genshin Impact's McDonald's Collaboration Might Have Fit Better In One Other HoYo Game
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Genshin Impact collaborated with McDonald's in the US for limited-time menu items, offering in-game rewards.
  • Fans had mixed reactions, questioning the fit of the collab with Genshin Impact's brand aesthetics.
  • Another game, Zenless Zone Zero, is highlighted as a better match for modern brand collaborations.

As part of HoYoverse's marketing efforts, Genshin Impact has collaborated with many restaurants and brands around the world to create special menu items. The game has unique food and drink consumables inspired by real-world dishes, which many fans have tried to replicate at home. It only makes sense for Genshin Impact to let people experience its culinary offerings in creative ways.

Recently, Genshin Impact announced a collaboration with McDonald's in the United States. From September 17 to 29, fans can purchase the "Genshin Impact Apple Pie" and "Genshin Impact Deluxe McCrispy Meal" via the McDonald's app, which will also include Primogems and other in-game rewards. The collab is a simple way to enjoy good food and gain limited-time rewards, but many fans seemed to agree that it might not be on-brand for Genshin Impact . However, it would have fit Zenless Zone Zero quite well.

The McDonald's Collab Could Be a Better Match for Genshin Impact's More Modern Sibling

When Genshin Impact 's McDonald's collaboration was first announced, it was surprisingly met with a lot of skepticism from many fans. While this isn't the first time that the game had a collab with a popular restaurant chain, as Genshin Impact previously partnered with KFC and Pizza Hut, people online didn't seem sold on the food offerings and perks. On the other hand, there were still some who were excited about getting the special cosmetics which were previously only available in select countries.

Genshin Impact x McDonald's Menu Items

  • Genshin Impact Apple Pie: Possibly inspired by the Apple Roly Poly from Good Hunter
  • Genshin Impact Deluxe McCrispy Meal: The chicken burger could be a different iteration of the Golden Chicken Burger from Genshin Impact 's KFC collab

Meanwhile, one HoYoverse title definitely matches the modern vibe of McDonald's, and that is the futuristic action RPG Zenless Zone Zero. Set in the bustling city of New Eridu, Zenless Zone Zero features a number of restaurants offering various types of ramen and coffee. Fans can expect more establishments to appear in future updates, just like the Outer Ring's Cheesetopia in Zenless Zone Zero Version 1.2.

Ramen

Waterfall Soup on Sixth Street

Coffee

Coff Café on Sixth Street

This makes Zenless Zone Zero the perfect HoYoverse title to have a food collaboration next, especially with a modern brand like McDonald's. The caveat is that Zenless Zone Zero still has a limited selection of food items, so if it were to collaborate with McDonald's in the future, it would have to have consumables inspired by fried chicken, burgers, and apple pies. At this point, it makes a lot of sense for Zenless Zone Zero to come out with special ramen and coffee collaborations that come with in-game rewards in the near future.

Zenless Zone Zero Has a Lot of Collab Potential With Many Brands

Shortly after its release, Zenless Zone Zero caught the attention of many fans with a collaboration with Street Fighter 6 , which is also the game that inspired the HoYoverse title's combat mechanics. It also collaborated with the YouTube-popular Lofi Girl to produce lofi versions of Zenless Zone Zero 's tracks. So far, this shows a lot of potential for HoYoverse to come up with unique Zenless Zone Zero collaborations beyond food partnerships.

With its heavy focus on technological advancements, it only makes sense for Zenless Zone Zero to do a collaboration with tech brands for a custom collection. Recently, Genshin Impact revealed that it partnered with Logitech to release limited-edition gaming peripherals, starting off with Lightspeed mice with designs inspired by characters like Kamisato Ayaka and Sayu. Zenless Zone Zero could take a similar direction to spotlight certain Agents.

Zenless Zone Zero could even capitalize on Bangboos with toy collaborations with brands like Build-a-Bear and Squishmallows. These cute characters are a great way to showcase the different Bangboo forms, and get more eyes on the game through the power of cuteness.

item.title: The Finals - Season 4 Official Trailer
item.description: Free-to-play first-person shooter The Finals reveals its Season 4 content ahead of the season's launch, which is scheduled for September 26, 2024. The Season 4 content includes a new map, new rewards, and the return of ranked Cashout.

item.title: Half-Life Beta From 1998 Has Been Discovered
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • An old beta build of Half-Life has surfaced online.
  • The leaked beta is dated to October 1998, thus predating the game's commercial debut by just a few weeks.
  • The build contains some cut content, including a different Chapter 13 level and another alien enemy. It also contains time-bomb code meant to prevent it from being played past a certain date.

An old beta build of Half-Life containing some cut content has surfaced online. The leaked version of the game is dated to October 1998, indicating that it predates Half-Life 's official release by just a few weeks.

November 19 will mark Half-Life 's 26th anniversary. Valve's first-ever game is still widely touted as one of the most seminal first-person shooters in the history of gaming. One of the final things that Valve was working on over the course of its development was PvP multiplayer, which the company was ironing out until the very last moment.

Half-Life Beta Build Containing Cut Level Leaks Online

A testament to these efforts has now emerged online in the form of a Half-Life beta build uncovered by game researcher Frogsnatcher. This pre-release version of the game was found on an old CD dated October 20, 1998, suggesting the build predates the shooter's commercial debut by roughly one month. The disc itself has "net test 2" written on it in a sharpie pen, which indicates that this beta was primarily geared toward ironing out the game's multiplayer features right before Valve hit it big with Half-Life . That notwithstanding, one of the biggest differences between the leaked beta and the finished product has nothing to do with multiplayer, but a cut single-player level called The Communications Center.

The Communications Center was envisioned as the original version of Forget About Freeman, Half-Life 's Chapter 13. According to past reports, this map was designed by Valve engineers John Guthrie and Kelly Bailey. Its beta version is mostly static, except for a large radar dish that was scripted to turn. Other levels from the leaked build also have some scripting differences compared to the finished product, though they are largely inconsequential, Frogsnatcher reports.

Leaked Half-Life Beta Build Comes With a Time Bomb

Although Frogsnatcher already shared a dump of the game's 1998 beta disc, playing it is not a straightforward affair. This is largely because the beta comes with some time-bomb code that prevents it from being activated past a certain date. Frogsnatcher said that this was easy enough to side-step by setting their system date to any day during October 1998. According to some other early reports from fans who gave the build a go, the leaked beta can only be run in the Windows ME Compatibility Mode.

Frogsnatcher has also uncovered some unused textures in the net test, with most of them being of the weapon variety. E.g., the beta build's crossbow looks slightly different, on account of having a different bolt-mounting mechanism. The researcher also discovered a static model of Stukabat, a flying alien enemy that was cut from the original Half-Life near the end of the game's development.
